summary.long: 1 Chronicles is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Noah and his sons: Shem, Ham and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush was the father of Nimrod. He began to be a powerful one on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mizraim was the father of the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrus, Casluh (where the Philistines came from), and Caphtor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Canaan was the father of Sidon his first-born, and Heth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arpachshad was the father of Shelah. And Shelah was the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two sons were born to Eber. The name of one was Peleg, for the earth was divided in his days. And his brother’s name was Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abram, that is Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are their children. Ishmael’s first-born son was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jetur, Naphish and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keturah was the woman who acted as Abraham’s wife. She gave birth to Abraham’s sons, Zimram, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abraham was the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac were Esau and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam. Lotan’s sister was Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anah’s son was Dishon. And the sons of Dishon were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran and Cheran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ezer were Bilhan, Zaavan and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan were Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the kings who ruled in the land of Edom before any kings of Israel ruled. Bela was the son of Beor. The name of his city was Dinhabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad became king in his place. Hadad won the battle against Midian in the field of Moab. The name of his city was Avith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth by the Euphrates River became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad became king in his place. The name of his city was Pai. His wife’s name was Mehetabel the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hadad died. Now the leaders of Edom were Timna, Aliah, Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the leaders of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel were Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Napthali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua of Canaan. Judah’s first-born son Er was sinful in the eyes of the Lord. So the Lord put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar gave birth to Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol and Dara, five in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carmi’s son was Achar, who brought trouble to Israel by sinning against what was holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Ethan was Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons born to Hezron were Jerahmeel, Ram and Chelubai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, the leader of the sons of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahshon was the father of Salma. Salma was the father of Boaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boaz was the father of Obed. And Obed was the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesse was the father of Eliab his first-born, then Abinadab his second son, and Shimea his third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nethanel was his fourth son, Raddai the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ozem the sixth, and David the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. Zeruiah’s three sons were Abshai, Joab and Asahel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail gave birth to Amasa. And Amasa’s father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezron’s son Caleb had sons by his wives Azubah and Jerioth. Azubah’s sons were Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath. She gave birth to his son Hur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hur was the father of Uri. And Uri was the father of Bezalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, when Hezron was sixty years old, he married the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. She gave birth to his son Segub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath and its towns. They took sixty cities in all. All these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, his wife Abijah gave birth to his son Ashhur. Ashhur was the father of Tekoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hezron’s first-born Jerahmeel were Ram the first-born, then Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah. She was the mother of Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jerahmeel’s first-born son Ram were Maaz, Jamin and Eker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. And the sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail. She gave birth to his sons Ahban and Molid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim. Seled died without sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appaim’s son was Ishi. Ishi’s son was Sheshan. And Sheshan’s son was Ahlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shammai’s brother Jada were Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. And Sheshan had an Egyptian servant whose name was Jarha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheshan gave his daughter to his servant Jarha in marriage. And she gave birth to his son Attai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai was the father of Nathan. Nathan was the father of Zabad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zabad was the father of Ephlal. Ephlal was the father of Obed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obed was the father of Jehu. Jehu was the father of Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah was the father of Helez. Helez was the father of Eleasah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleasah was the father of Sismai. Sismai was the father of Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah. And Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Jerahmeel’s brother Caleb. Mesha was his first-born and the father of Ziph. His son was Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shema was the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam. Rekem was the father of Shammai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shammai’s son was Maon. Maon was the father of Bethzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephah was the woman who acted as Caleb’s wife. She gave birth to Haran, Moza and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maacah, who acted as Caleb’s wife, gave birth to Sheber and Tirhanah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also gave birth to Shaaph the father of Madmannah, and Sheva the father of Machbena and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Achsah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the children of Caleb.
The sons of Ephrathah’s first-born son Hur were Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had other sons. These were Haroeh, half of the Manahathites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the families of Kiriath-jearim. These families were the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Salma were Bethlehem and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half of the Manahathites, and the Zorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the writers who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, the Shimeathites and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron. The first-born was Amnon, whose mother was Ahinoam of Jezreel. The second was Daniel, the son of Abigail of Carmel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third was Absalom the son of Maacah, the daughter of King Talmai of Geshur. The fourth was Adonijah the son of Haggith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth was Shephatiah the son of Abital. And the sixth was Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six sons were born to David in Hebron. He ruled there for seven years and six months. And he ruled in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons who were born to him in Jerusalem: Bathsheba the daughter of Ammiel gave birth to David’s four sons, Shimea, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of David, added to the sons of the women who acted as David’s wives. Tamar was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam. Abijah was his son. Asa was his son. Jehoshaphat was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joram was his son. Ahaziah was his son. Joash was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amaziah was his son. Azariah was his son. Jotham was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was his son. Hezekiah was his son. Manasseh was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amon was his son. And Josiah was his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Josiah were Johanan the first-born, Jehoiakim the second, Zedekiah the third, and Shallum the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehoiakim were Jeconiah and Zedekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeconiah was taken away to prison by the Babylonians. His sons were Shealtiel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pedaiah’s sons were Zerubbabel and Shimei. And the sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam and Hananiah. Shelomith was their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five other sons of Zerubbabel were Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, whose son was Rephaiah. His son was Arnan. His son was Obadiah. And his son was Shecaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shecaniah’s son was Shemaiah, whose sons were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the seven sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur and Shobal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shobal’s son Reaiah was the father of Jahath. And Jahath was the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Etam were Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. The name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Penuel was the father of Gedor. Ezer was the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the first-born of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tekoa’s father Ashhur had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naarah gave birth to Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar and Ethnan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Koz was the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez was more a man of honor than his brothers. His mother gave him the name Jabez, saying, “Because I gave birth to him in pain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “O, if only You would bring good to me and give me more land! If only Your hand might be with me, that You would keep me from being hurt!” And God gave him what he asked for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shuhah’s brother Chelub was the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eshton was the father of Beth-rapha and Paseah. Tehinnah was the father of Irnahash. These are the men of Recah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kenaz were Othniel and Seraiah. Othniel’s son was Hathath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meonothai was the father of Ophrah. Seraiah was the father of Joab, who was the father of Ge-harashim. They were good at making things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jephunneh’s son Caleb was the father of Iru, Elah and Naam. Elah’s son was Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehallel were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ezrah were Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. These are the sons of Pharaoh’s daughter Bithia, whom Mered married. She gave birth to Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mered’s Jewish wife gave birth to Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hodiah’s wife, the sister of Naham, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimon’s sons were Amnon, Rinnah, Benhanan and Tilon. The sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were Er the father of Lecah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of those who worked with linen at Bethashbea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelah’s other sons were Jokim, the men of Cozeba, Joash, Saraph who ruled in Moab, and Jaashubi-lehem. The writings of these times are old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the people who made pots and lived in Netaim and Gederah. They lived there with the king for his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Saul’s son was Shallum. His son was Mibsam. And his son was Mishma.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma’s sons were Hammuel, Zaccur his son, and Shimei his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters. But his brothers did not have many children. Their whole family did not have many children, like the sons of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived at Beersheba, Moladah, Hazarshual,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until David ruled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their towns were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen and Ashan, five towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they had all the small towns that were around these towns as far as Baal. These were the places where they lived. And they wrote down all the names of their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heads of their families were Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah the son of Amaziah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the names of the heads of their families. And many were added to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the gate of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, to look for fields for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they found good fields rich with grass. The land was wide and quiet, and there they had peace. For Hamites had lived there before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These whose names have been written down came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah. They destroyed their tents and the Meunites who were found there. They destroyed all of them to this day, and lived in their place because there were fields for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of them, 500 sons of Simeon, went to Mount Seir. Their leaders were Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They destroyed the rest of the Amalekites who had run away to be safe. And they have lived there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben was the first-born son of Israel but because he sinned against his father’s marriage bed, his birth-right was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel. Reuben is not written down in the family names by his birth-right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah became stronger than his brothers, and a prince came from him. But the birth-right belonged to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Joel were Shemaiah, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beerah his son. Beerah was the one whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away to a strange land. He was a leader of the Reubenites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are his brothers by their families, from the writings of their family names. There was Jeiel the leader, then Zechariah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal-meon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He lived as far east as the beginning of the desert this side of the Euphrates River, because their cattle had become too many for the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Saul they made war with the Hagrites and killed them. So they lived in their tents over all the land east of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad lived beside them in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel was the leader. Then there was Shapham, then Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their seven brothers of their fathers’ houses were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was head of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its towns, and in all the fields of Sharon as far as they go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these were added to the family names in the days of King Jotham of Judah and King Jeroboam of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben, the Gadites and the half-family group of Manasseh were powerful soldiers. They carried the battle-covering and the sword, and shot with the bow. They were able men in battle. There were 44,760 of them who went to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made war against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish and Nodab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were given help against them, and the Hagrites and all who were with them were given into their hand. They cried out to God in the battle. He gave them what they asked for, because they trusted in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took away their animals, 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys, and 100,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many were killed, because the war was of God. They lived in their place until they were taken away by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of the half-family group of Manasseh lived in the land. There were many of them from Bashan to Baal-hermon, Senir and Mount Hermon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heads of their fathers’ houses were Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were powerful soldiers, men whose names were well-known. And they were heads of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they sinned against the God of their fathers. They sold themselves to the gods of the people of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the God of Israel moved the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, also known as Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria. And he carried the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-family group of Manasseh away to a strange land. He brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river of Gozan. And they are there to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Amram were Aaron, Moses and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar was the father of Phinehas. Phinehas was the father of Abishua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua was the father of Bukki. Bukki was the father of Uzzi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzzi was the father of Zerahiah. Zerahiah was the father of Meraioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meraioth was the father of Amariah. Amariah was the father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahitub was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Ahimaaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahimaaz was the father of Azariah. Azariah was the father of Johanan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan was the father of Azariah. (He was the one who served as the religious leader in the house which Solomon built in Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah was the father of Amariah. Amariah was the father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahitub was the father of Zadok. Zadok was the father of Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum was the father of Hilkiah. Hilkiah was the father of Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah was the father of Seraiah. Seraiah was the father of Jehozadak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehozadak was taken away when the Lord carried Judah and Jerusalem away to a strange land by Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Levi were Gershom, Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The names of the sons of Gershom were Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites by their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Gershom there were Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, and Jeatherai his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Kohath were Amminadab, Korah his son, Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elkanah his son, Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Saul his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Elkanah were Amasai and Ahimoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elkanah his son, Zophai his son, Nahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Samuel were Joel the first-born, and Abijah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, and Asaiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David chose these men to lead the singing in the house of the Lord, after the special box with the Law of the Lord rested there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They led the singing in front of the meeting tent until Solomon had built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem. And they took their places for their work at the right times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men who served, and their sons. From the sons of the Kohathites were Heman the singer, the son of Joel, son of Samuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Elkanah, son of Jeroham, son of Eliel, son of Toah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Zuph, son of Elkanah, son of Mahath, son of Amasai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Elkanah, son of Joel, son of Azariah, son of Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Tahath. Tahath was the son of Assir, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, son of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heman’s brother Asaph stood at his right hand. Asaph was the son of Berechiah, son of Shimea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Michael, son of Baaseiah, son of Malchijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Ethni, son of Zerah. Zerah was the son of Adaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Ethan, son of Zimmah, son of Shimei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Jahath, son of Gershom, son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the left hand were their brothers the sons of Merari. There was Ethan the son of Kishi, son of Abdi, son of Malluch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Hashabiah, son of Amaziah. Amaziah was the son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Amzi, son of Bani, son of Shemer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: son of Mahli, son of Mushi, son of Merari, son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers the Levites were chosen for all the work of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Aaron and his sons gave the gifts on the altar of burnt gifts and on the altar of special perfume. They did all the work of the most holy place, to pay for the sins of Israel. They did all that Moses the servant of God had told them to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron were Eleazar, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok his son, and Ahimaaz his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the places where they lived in their lands. The sons of Aaron of the families of the Kohathites were first to choose where to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were given Hebron in the land of Judah, and the fields around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fields of the city and its towns were given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Aaron were given cities where people go to be safe. These cities were Hebron, Libnah with its fields, Jatir, Eshtemoa with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilen with its fields, Debir with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashan with its fields, and Beth-shemesh with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the family of Benjamin they were given Geba with its fields, Allemeth with its fields, and Anathoth with its fields. There were thirteen cities in all, by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cities were given, by drawing names, to the rest of the sons of Kohath. These cities were given from the families of the half-family group of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thirteen cities were given to the sons of Gershom, by their families. These cities were given from the families of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve cities were given, by drawing names, to the sons of Merari, by their families. These cities were given from the families of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By drawing names, they gave them these cities which are written here, from the families of the sons of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their land from the family of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were given cities where anyone could go to be safe. These cities were Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim with its fields, Gezer with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokmeam with its fields, Beth-horon with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon with its fields, and Gath-rimmon with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-family group of Manasseh they were given Aner with its fields and Bileam with its fields. They were for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cities were given to the sons of Gershom from the half-family group of Manasseh. These cities were Golan in Bashan with its fields and Ashtaroth with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the family of Issachar they were given Kedesh with its fields, Daberath with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ramoth with its fields, and Anem with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the family of Asher they were given Mashal with its fields, Abdon with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hukok with its fields, and Rehob with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the family of Naphtali they were given Kedesh in Galilee with its fields, Hammon with its fields, and Kiriathaim with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari were given cities from the family of Zebulun. These cities were Rimmono with its fields and Tabor with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other side of the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, they were given cities from the family of Reuben. These cities were Bezer in the desert with its fields, Jahzah with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth with its fields, and Mephaath with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the family of Gad they were given Ramoth in Gilead with its fields, Mahanaim with its fields,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon with its fields, and Jazer with its fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The four sons of Issachar were Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel, heads of their fathers’ houses. Tola’s sons were powerful soldiers among the people of their day. There were 22,600 of these men in the days of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Uzzi was Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah were Michael, Obadiah, Joel and Isshiah. All five of them were leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them by their families and by their fathers’ houses were 36,000 men ready to fight. For they had many wives and sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers among all the families of Issachar were powerful soldiers. There were 87,000 of them, whose names were written down by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three sons of Benjamin were Bela, Becher and Jediael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The five sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri. They were heads of their fathers’ houses and powerful soldiers. There were 22,034 of them, whose names were written down by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Becher were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their names were written down by their families. They were heads of their fathers’ houses, 20,200 powerful soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jediael was Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers’ houses. They were 17,200 powerful soldiers, who were ready to go out with the army to battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir. Hushim was the son of Aher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh’s sons were Asriel and Machir the father of Gilead. Their mother was the Aramaean woman who acted as Manasseh’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Machir took a wife of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maacah. The name of the second was Zelophehad. And Zelophehad had daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Machir’s wife Maacah gave birth to a son, and gave him the name Peresh. His brother’s name was Sheresh. And his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Ulam was Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sister Hammolecheth gave birth to Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim’s sons were Shuthelah and Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead. The men of Gath who were born in the land killed Ezer and Elead, because they came down to take their cattle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their father Ephraim was filled with sorrow for many days. And his brothers came to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went in to his wife and she was able to have a child and gave birth to a son. Ephraim gave him the name Beriah, because trouble had come upon his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beriah’s daughter was Sheerah. She built both parts of Beth-horon, and Uzzen-sheerah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rephah was his son, Resheph his son, Telah his son, Tahan his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their cities and their lands were Bethel with its towns, Naaran to the east, Gezer to the west with its towns, and Shechem with its towns as far as Ayyah with its towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beside the land of the sons of Manasseh, they lived in Beth-shean with its towns, Taanach with its towns, Megiddo with its towns, and Dor with its towns. In these cities lived the sons of Joseph the son of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and Serah their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Japhlet were Pasach, Bimhal and Ashvath. These were the sons of Japhlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemer were Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of his brother Helem were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zophah were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jether were Jephunneh, Pispa and Ara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Asher and heads of the fathers’ houses. They were chosen men and powerful soldiers, leaders of the king’s sons. There were 26,000 of them, whose names were written down by their families for fighting in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin was the father of Bela his first-born, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela’s sons were Addar, Gera, Abihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ehud were the heads of fathers’ houses of the people of Geba. They were taken away to Manahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their names were Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera, that is, Heglam, who was the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had sent away Hushim and Baara his wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his wife Hodesh he became the father of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeuz, Sachia and Mirmah. These were his sons. They were heads of fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By his wife Hushim he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Elpaal were Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod with its towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elpaal was the father of Beriah and Shema also. They were heads of fathers’ houses of the people of Aijalon, who drove away the people of Gath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elpaal’s other sons were Ahio, Shashak and Jeremoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Michael, Ishpah and Joha were the sons of Beriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphdeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jaareshiah, Elijah and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were heads of the fathers’ houses by their families. They were leaders who lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gibeon’s father Jeiel lived in Gibeon. The name of Jeiel’s wife was Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons were Abdon his first-born, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio and Zecher,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Mikloth the father of Shimeah. They lived with their brothers in Jerusalem beside their other brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab and Eshbaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal was the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tarea and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jehoaddah. Jehoaddah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea. Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The names of Azel’s six sons were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of his brother Eshek were Ulam his first-born, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ulam were powerful soldiers. They fought with the bow. And they had 150 sons and grandsons. All these were the sons of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the names of all Israel were written down by families. See, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. And Judah was carried away to Babylon because they were not faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first ones to live again in their land and in their cities were Israel, the religious leaders, the Levites and the servants of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the people of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim and Manasseh lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, from the sons of Perez the son of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Shilonites were Asaiah the first-born and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Zerah were Jeuel and their brothers, 690 of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Benjamin were Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, Elah the son of Uzzi, son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, son of Reuel, son of Ibnijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were their brothers by their families, 956 of them. All these were heads of fathers’ houses by their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the religious leaders were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Azariah the son of Hilkiah, son of Meshullam, son of Zadok, son of Meraioth, son of Ahitub. He was the head leader of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Adaiah the son of Jeroham, son of Pashhur, son of Malchijah. There was Maasai the son of Adiel, son of Jahzerah, son of Meshullam, son of Meshillemith, son of Immer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were 1,760 of their brothers, who were heads of their fathers’ houses. They were very able men for the work of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Levites were Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, son of Azrikam, son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, son of Zichri, son of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, son of Galal, son of Jeduthun. And there was Berechiah the son of Asa, son of Elkanah, who lived in the towns of the Netophathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gate-keepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman and their brothers. (Shallum was the leader
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was at the king’s gate on the east side.) These were the gate-keepers for the family group of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum the son of Kore, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah, and his brothers of his father’s house, were the Korahites. They led the work, and they watched the doors of the meeting tent. Their fathers had taken care of the tents of the Lord, and had watched the doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar had ruled over them before. And the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah watched the gate of the meeting tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 212 of those who were chosen to watch the gates. Their names were written down by families in their towns. David and Samuel the man of God chose them for places of trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and their sons were gate-keepers of the Lord’s house, the holy tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gate-keepers were on the four sides, to the east, west, north and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those of their family in other towns were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the four head men who were gate-keepers were Levites and were in a place of trust. They watched over the rooms and the riches in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stayed during the night around the house of God. For their duty was to watch. And they were to open the house every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them took care of the things used for worship. They numbered them when they were brought in and taken out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were chosen to take care of the objects of the holy place, the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the special perfume, and the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the sons of the religious leaders did the work of mixing the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mattithiah was one of the Levites, the first-born of Shallum the Korahite. He took care of the making of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of their brothers of the Kohathites took care of the making of the holy bread every Day of Rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the singers. They were heads of fathers’ houses of the Levites, who lived in the rooms of the Lord’s house. They were free from other kinds of worship, for they were on duty day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were heads of fathers’ houses of the Levites by their families. They were leaders who lived in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gibeon’s father Jeiel lived in Gibeon. The name of Jeiel’s wife was Maacah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sons were Abdon the first-born, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah and Mikloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth was the father of Shimeam. They lived with their brothers in Jerusalem beside their other brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner was the father of Kish. Kish was the father of Saul. Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab and Eshbaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Jonathan was Merib-baal. Merib-baal was the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was the father of Jarah. Jarah was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth and Zimri. Zimri was the father of Moza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moza was the father of Binea and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azel had six sons whose names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the many Philistines fought against Israel. The men of Israel ran away from the Philistines, and were killed on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines went after Saul and his sons. And they killed Jonathan, Abinadab and Malchi-shua, Saul’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The battle was hard for Saul. Those who fought with the bow found him, and hurt him with an arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Saul said to the one who carried his battle-clothes, “Take your sword and kill me with it. Or these men who have not gone through our religious act will come and make fun of me.” But the one who carried his battle-clothes would not do it. For he was very afraid. So Saul took his sword and fell on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the one who carried his battle-clothes saw that Saul was dead, he fell on his sword and died also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul died with his three sons. All those of his house died together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that the army had run away and that Saul and his sons were dead. So they left their cities and ran away. Then the Philistines came and lived in their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Philistines came the next day to take what had belonged to the dead, they found Saul and his sons dead on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took his clothes, his head, and his battle-clothes. And they sent men around the land of the Philistines to take the good news to their false gods and to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put Saul’s battle-clothes in the house of their gods. And they put his head in the house of Dagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people of Jabesh-gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the powerful soldiers went and took the bodies of Saul and his sons. They brought them to Jabesh and buried their bones under the oak tree there. Then they went without food for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul died for his sin against the Lord, because he did not keep the Word of the Lord. He had asked a woman who spoke with spirits what he should do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not ask the Lord. So the Lord killed him, and gave the nation to David the son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all Israel came to David at Hebron and said, “See, we are your bone and your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In times past, even when Saul was king, you were the one who led out and brought in Israel. The Lord your God said to you, ‘You will be the shepherd of My people Israel. And you will be king over My people Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the leaders of Israel came to the king at Hebron. And David made an agreement with them in Hebron before the Lord. Then they poured oil on David to be the king of Israel, just as the Lord had said through Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus). And the Jebusites, the people of the land, were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Jebus said to David, “You will not come in here.” But David took the strong-place of Zion (that is, the city of David).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David had said, “Whoever kills a Jebusite first will be captain and leader.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, so he became captain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David lived in the strong-place. So it was called the city of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the city all around, from the Millo and then around. And Joab built the rest of the city up again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David became greater and greater, for the Lord of All was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the leaders of David’s strong men. They gave him much help in his nation, together with all Israel, to make him king. It was just as the Lord had said would happen with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of David’s strong men. There was Jashobeam the son of Hachmonite, the head of the thirty. He killed 300 men with his spear at one time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite. He was one of the three powerful soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with David at Pasdammim when the Philistines were gathered there to battle, where there was a piece of ground full of grain. And the people ran away from the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he and his men stood on the piece of ground and fought for it, and killed the Philistines. The Lord saved them by His great power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three of the thirty leaders went down to the rock and into the cave of Adullam where David was staying. The Philistine army was staying in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was in a strong-place, while the Philistine soldiers had their place in Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David had a strong desire. He said, “O, if only someone would give me water to drink from the well by the gate of Bethlehem!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the three men broke through the Philistine army. They took water from the well by the gate of Bethlehem, and brought it to David. But David would not drink it. He poured it out to the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “Far be it from me that I should do this before my God. Should I drink the blood of these men? For they put their lives in danger to bring it.” So he would not drink it. These things are what the three powerful soldiers did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Abishai the brother of Joab, he was the head of the thirty. He fought and killed 300 men with his spear. And his name became well-known like the three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was the best known of the thirty. But he was not as important as the three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a powerful soldier from Kabzeel, did great things. He killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He went down and killed a lion inside a deep hole on a day when there was snow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he killed an Egyptian who was very tall, five cubits tall. The Egyptian held a spear as big as the cross-piece of a cloth-maker. But Benaiah went down to him with a heavy stick and took the spear from the Egyptian’s hand. Then he killed him with his own spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the things Benaiah the son of Johoiada did. His name was well-known like the three powerful soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was respected among the thirty. But he was not as important as the three. David chose him to be the head of his house soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The strong men of the armies were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shammoth the Harorite, and Helez the Pelonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, and Ilai the Ahohite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, and Benaiah the Pirathonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Hurai of the rivers of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite. There were Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahiam the son of Sachar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hepher the Mecherathite, and Ahijah the Pelonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite. Naharai was the one who carried the battle-clothes of Joab the son of Zeruiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite. Adina was a leader of the Reubenites, and had thirty men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then there were Hanan the son of Maacah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, and Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Jediael the son of Shimri, his brother Joha the Tizite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam. And there were Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men who came to David at Ziklag, while David was still hidden because of Saul the son of Kish. They were among the strong men who helped him in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fought with the bow. They could also throw stones or shoot arrows with both the right and left hand. They were Saul’s brothers from Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader was Ahiezer, then Joash. Both of them were sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite. And there were Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth, Beracah, Jehu the Anathothite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite. He was a strong man among the thirty, and a leader over them. There were Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad the Gederathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the Korahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Powerful soldiers came from the Gadites to David in the strong-place in the desert. They had been taught how to fight in war, and could use the battle-covering and spear. Their faces were like the faces of lions. And they were as fast as the deer on the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezer was the first. Obadiah was the second. Eliab was the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishmannah was the fourth. Jeremiah was the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai was the sixth. Eliel was the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan was the eighth. Elzabad was the ninth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah was the tenth. Machbannai was the eleventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These Gadites were captains of the army. He who was least led 100. And he who was greatest led 1,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month when the water was flowing over its sides. They drove away all those in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the sons of Benjamin and Judah came to David at his strong-place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David went out to meet them. He said to them, “If you come in peace to help me, my heart will be joined to you. But if you have come to hand me over to those who hate me, may the God of our fathers see it and speak strong words to you. For I have done nothing wrong.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai the captain of the thirty. Amasai said, “We are yours, O David! We are with you, O son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, and peace to those who help you! For your God helps you!” Then David received them and made them captains of his soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men from Manasseh came over to David’s side when he was about to go to battle with the Philistines against Saul. But they did not help him. For after talking it over, the Philistine leaders sent him away, saying, “He might go over to Saul’s side with our heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men who came over to David’s side from Manasseh as he went to Ziklag were Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu and Zillethai. They were captains of thousands who belonged to Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They helped David against the army of soldiers who came to fight him. For they were all powerful soldiers, and captains in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each day men came to David to help him. They came until there was a great army, like the army of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbers of the armies who came to David at Hebron. They came to turn the nation of Saul to him, as the Word of the Lord had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 6,800 sons of Judah who carried a battle-covering and spear, ready for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 7,100 powerful soldiers from the sons of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 4,600 sons of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron. There were 3,700 men with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was Zadok, a young, powerful soldier, and twenty-two captains from his own father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 3,000 sons of Benjamin, Saul’s brothers. For until now most of them had stayed faithful to the house of Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 20,800 powerful soldiers from the sons of Ephraim. They were important men in their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 18,000 men of the half-family group of Manasseh. They were chosen by name to come and make David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 200 captains of the sons of Issachar. They understood the times and had much understanding of what Israel should do. And all their brothers obeyed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 50,000 men of Zebulun who were soldiers. They could fight in battle with everything used in war. And they helped David as if they had one heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 1,000 captains from Naphtali. With them were 37,000 men with battle-coverings and spears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 28,600 Danites ready for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 40,000 soldiers from Asher, ready for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were 120,000 sons of Reuben, Gad and the half-family group of Manasseh from the other side of the Jordan. They came with everything used in war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were men of war, ready for battle. They came to Hebron with one desire, to make David the king of all Israel. And all the rest of Israel were of one mind to make David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were there with David for three days, eating and drinking. For their brothers had made food ready for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their neighbors brought food, from as far as Issachar, Zebulun and Naphtali. They brought food on donkeys, camels, horses and cattle. They brought many loaves of bread and figs, many dried grapes, wine, oil, cattle and sheep. For there was joy in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David spoke with the captains of the thousands and the hundreds and with every leader about what should be done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David spoke to all the people of Israel. He said, “If you think it is good, and if it is from the Lord our God, let us send word to our brothers who are staying in all the land of Israel. Let us send word to the religious leaders and Levites who are with them in their cities that have fields. And let us ask them to meet with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us bring the special box with the Law of our God to us. For we did not think of it in the days of Saul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people said that they would do so. For it was right in the eyes of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gathered all Israel together, from the Shihor of Egypt to the gate of Hamath, to bring the special box of God from Kiriath-jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim which belongs to Judah. They went to bring the special box of God. It is called by the name of the Lord Who sits on His throne above the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They carried the special box of God on a new wagon from the house of Abinadab. And Uzza and Ahio drove the wagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and all Israel were showing their joy before God with all their strength. They were singing and playing harps and timbrels, and blowing horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the grain-floor of Chidon, the cattle pulling the wagon tripped. And Uzza put out his hand to hold the special box of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the anger of the Lord burned against Uzza. So He killed him because Uzza had put out his hand to the special box of God, so before God he died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David became angry because the Lord had killed Uzza in His anger. That place is called Perez-uzza to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the special box of God home to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David did not take the special box of God with him to the city of David. He took it aside to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The special box of God stayed with the family of Obed-edom in his house for three months. The Lord brought good to Obed-edom’s family and all that he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Hiram of Tyre sent men with cedar trees to David. With them came men who worked with stone and wood. They came to build a house for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David understood that the Lord had made him to be king of Israel. He knew that his nation was very honored because of God’s people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David took more wives at Jerusalem. He became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The names of the children born to him in Jerusalem are Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Beeliada and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines heard that David had been chosen as king of all Israel. So they went up to look for him. David heard of it and went out against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines had come to fight a surprise battle in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David asked God, “Should I go fight against the Philistines? Will You give them to me?” And the Lord said to him, “Go, for I will give them to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David won the battle against them there. David said, “By my hand God has broken through those who hate me, like the breaking through of a flood.” So they gave that place the name Baal-perazim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines left their gods there. So David had them burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines fought another surprise battle in the valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David asked God again what he should do. God said to him, “Do not go after them. Go around behind them, and come upon them in front of the balsam trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear the sound of their steps in the tops of the balsam trees, then go out to battle. For God will have gone out before you to destroy the Philistine army.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did just as God had told him, and they destroyed the Philistine army from Gibeon as far as Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the name of David became known in all the lands. The Lord brought the fear of him upon all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David built houses for himself in the city of David. He made a place ready for the special box of God. And he set up a tent for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “No one but the Levites may carry the special box of God. For the Lord chose them to carry the special box of the agreement and to serve Him forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered all Israel together at Jerusalem, to bring up the special box of the Lord to the place he had made for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered together the sons of Aaron and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uriel became leader of the sons of Kohath, and 120 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaiah became the leader of the sons of Merari, and 220 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel became the leader of the sons of Gershom, and 130 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shemaiah became the leader of the sons of Elizaphan, and 200 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel became the leader of the sons of Hebron, and 80 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amminadab became the leader of the sons of Uzziel, and 112 of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David called for Zadok and Abiathar the religious leaders. And he called for the Levites, Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel and Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites. Make yourselves and your brothers holy, that you may bring up the special box of the Lord God of Israel to the place I have made for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord our God brought trouble upon us because you did not carry it the first time. We did not care for it the way He had told us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the religious leaders and the Levites made themselves holy, to bring up the special box of the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of the Levites carried the special box of God on their shoulders with the long pieces of wood. They did as Moses had told them by the Word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David told the heads of the Levites to choose their brothers who sing and play music. They were to play harps and timbrels and make sounds of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites chose Heman the son of Joel. From his brothers they chose Asaph the son of Berechiah. From the sons of Merari their brothers, they chose Ethan the son of Kushaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them they chose their brothers of the second group. These were Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the gate-keepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The singers, Heman, Asaph and Ethan were chosen to make sounds of joy with objects of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah and Benaiah were chosen to play the high sounds on harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel and Azaziah were chosen to lead by playing the deep sounds on different kinds of harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chenaniah, head of the Levites, was to lead the singing. He taught the singing because he was able.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Berechiah and Elkanah were to watch the gate for the special box.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah and Eliezer, the religious leaders, were to blow the horns in front of the special box of God. Obed-edom and Jehiah were gate-keepers for the special box of God also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David, the leaders of Israel and the captains of thousands went to bring up the special box with the Law of the Lord from the house of Obed-edom with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God was helping the Levites who were carrying the special box of the agreement of the Lord. So they killed seven bulls and seven rams on the altar in worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was dressed in a long piece of clothing of fine linen. So were all the Levites who were carrying the special box of God. And so were the singers and Chenaniah the leader of the singing. David wore a linen vest also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all Israel brought up the special box with the Law of the Lord. They brought it up with a loud voice, the sound of horns, and with loud-sounding timbrels and harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the special box with the Law of the Lord came to the city of David, Saul’s daughter Michal looked out of the window. She saw King David dancing and jumping for joy. And she hated him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the special box of God, and put it inside the tent David had set up for it. Then they gave burnt gifts and peace gifts to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
