verses.text: When David finished giving the burnt gifts and peace gifts, he prayed in the name of the Lord that good would come to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave to every man and woman in Israel a loaf of bread, a share of meat, and a loaf of dried grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David chose some of the Levites to do the work in front of the special box of the Lord. They were to be glad and thank and praise the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph was the leader, then Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel. They were to play harps. And Asaph played loud-sounding timbrels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The religious leaders Benaiah and Jahaziel sounded the horns all the time in front of the special box with the Law of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on that day David first called upon Asaph and his brothers to give thanks to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O give thanks to the Lord. Call upon His name. Let the people know what He has done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing to Him. Sing praises to Him. Tell of all His great works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have joy in His holy name. Let the heart of those who look to the Lord be glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look to the Lord and ask for His strength. Look to Him all the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember His great works which He has done. Remember the special things He has done and how He has judged,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O children of Israel His servant, sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the Lord our God. He is judge of all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember His agreement forever, the Word which He gave to families and a thousand of their family groups to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember the agreement He made with Abraham, and His promise to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Jacob He made it a Law to be kept, as an agreement forever to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, ‘I will give the land of Canaan to you as the share of your birth-right,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they were few in number. They were very few, and strangers in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from nation to nation, from the people of one king to the people of another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He let no man make it hard for them. He spoke strong words to kings because of them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not touch My chosen ones. Do not hurt those who speak for Me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sing to the Lord, all the earth. Tell the good news of His saving power from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell of His greatness among the nations. Tell of His great works among all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For great is the Lord. He is to be given much praise. And He is to be honored with fear more than all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the gods of the people are false gods. But the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor and great power are with Him. Strength and joy are in His place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praise the Lord, O families of the people. Praise the Lord for His greatness and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Praise the Lord for the greatness of His name. Bring a gift and come to Him. Worship the Lord clothed in His holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shake with fear before Him, all the earth. Yes, the world is made to last. It will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the heavens be glad. Let the earth be filled with joy. And let them say among the nations, ‘The Lord rules!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the sea thunder, and all that is in it. Let the field be happy, and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the trees of the woods will sing for joy before the Lord. For He is coming to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O give thanks to the Lord, for He is good. His loving-kindness lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then say, ‘Set us free, O God Who saves us. Gather and save us from among the nations, to give thanks to Your holy name, and have joy in Your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor be to the Lord, the God of Israel forever and ever.’” Then all the people said, “Let it be so!” and they praised the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David left Asaph and his brothers there in front of the special box with the Law of the Lord. He left them there to do the work in front of the special box always. They were to do whatever work needed to be done each day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He left Obed-edom there with his sixty-eight brothers. Obed-edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were to watch the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David left Zadok and his brothers who were the religious leaders in front of the meeting tent of the Lord in the high place at Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were to give burnt gifts to the Lord on the altar of burnt gifts all the time, morning and evening. They were to do all that is written in the Law of the Lord which He told Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them were Heman, Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen by name. They were to give thanks to the Lord, because His loving-kindness lasts forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heman and Jeduthun had horns and timbrels for making sounds of joy as the songs of God were sung. The sons of Jeduthun were to watch the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people left. Each one went home. And David returned to bring good to those of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when David lived in his house, he said to Nathan the special preacher, “See, I am living in a house of cedar wood. But the special box with the Law of the Lord is under a tent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart. For God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that same night the Word of the Lord came to Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell My servant David, ‘This is what the Lord says. “You will not build a house for Me to live in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not lived in a house since the day I brought up Israel to this day. But I have gone from tent to tent and from one place to another to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all the places I have gone with all Israel, have I said a word to any of the judges of Israel about this? Have I said to anyone whom I told to watch over My people, ‘Why have you not built a house of cedar wood for Me?’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now say to My servant David, ‘The Lord of All says, “I took you from the field, from following the sheep, to be leader over My people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been with you in every place you have gone. I have destroyed in front of you all those who hate you. And I will make your name to be known like the name of the great ones of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will choose a place for My people Israel, and will plant them. So they will live in their own place and not be moved again. Never again will they be under the power of sinful men, as they were before,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from the time that I told judges to rule My people Israel. I will put under your power all those who hate you. And I say to you that the Lord will build a house for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When your days are over, the time will come when you must go to be with your fathers. But then I will put into power one of your sons after you. I will make him king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will build a house for Me. And I will make his throne last forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be his father, and he will be My son. I will not take My loving-kindness away from him, as I took it from him who was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will put him over My house and in My nation forever. And his throne will last forever.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathan told David all these words from all this special dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David went in and sat before the Lord, and said, “Who am I, O God? What is my house, that You have brought me this far?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was a small thing in Your eyes, O God. You have spoken of Your servant’s house for a long time to come. You have thought of me as if I were an important man, O Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What more can David say to You about the honor given to Your servant? For You know Your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have made all this greatness, O Lord. You have made known all these great things, for Your servant, and by Your own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, there is no one like You. There is no God other than You, by all that we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What other nation on earth is like Your people Israel? God went to free them to be His people. You made Yourself a name by great things which filled people with fear. You drove out the nations before Your people, whom You set free from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You made Your people Israel to be Your people forever. And You, O Lord, became their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, O Lord, let the Word that You have spoken about Your servant and his house be made sure forever. Do as You have said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Your name be made sure and honored forever, saying, ‘The Lord of All, the God of Israel, is Israel’s God. And the house of Your servant David is made to last before You.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You, O my God, have made it known to Your servant that You will build a house for him. So Your servant has found strength of heart to pray to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Lord, You are God. You have promised this good thing to Your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it has pleased You to bring good to the house of Your servant. May it last forever before You. For when You bring good to something, O Lord, good is with it forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this David won the war against the Philistines and put them under his power. He took Gath and its towns from the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He won the war against Moab. And the Moabites were made to work for David, bringing taxes to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David won the war against King Hadadezer of Zobah as far as Hamath, as he went to bring his power to the Euphrates River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took from him 1,000 war-wagons, 7,000 horsemen, and 20,000 foot soldiers. And he cut the legs of all but 100 war-wagon horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Syrians of Damascus came to help King Hadadezer of Zobah. But David killed 22,000 of the Syrian men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David put soldiers in Syria of Damascus. And the Syrians became servants to David, paying taxes. The Lord helped David in every place he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David took the battle-coverings of gold which were carried by Hadadezer’s servants, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took a very large amount of brass from Hadadezer’s cities, Tibhath and Cun. This was the brass Solomon used to make the brass pool, the pillars, and the brass pots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Tou of Hamath heard that David had won the war against all the army of King Hadadezer of Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent his son Hadoram to King David, to greet him and give honor to him, because David had fought against Hadadezer and won. For Hadadezer had been at war with Tou. Hadoram brought all kinds of things of gold and silver and brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David set these apart to the Lord, with the silver and gold he had carried away from all the nations. He took things from Edom, Moab, the sons of Ammon, the Philistines, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishai the son of Zeruiah won the war from 18,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put soldiers in Edom. And the Edomites became servants to David. The Lord helped David every place he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David ruled over all Israel. He did what was fair and right and good for all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah was captain of the army. Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud wrote down the things of the nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelech the son of Abiathar were religious leaders. Shavsha was the one who writes everything down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites. And the sons of David were leaders at the king’s side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Nahash the king of the Ammonites died. And his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent men to bring him comfort in his sorrow for his father. David’s servants came to Hanun in the land of the sons of Ammon, to bring him comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the princes of the sons of Ammon said to Hanun, “Do you think that David is giving honor to your father by sending men to comfort you? Have not his servants come to spy out the land and destroy it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hanun took David’s servants and cut the hair from their faces. Then he cut off the bottom half of their clothing, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was told what had happened to his servants, he sent men out to meet them because the workmen were very ashamed. The king said, “Stay at Jericho until the hair grows again on your faces, and then return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ammon saw that they had made themselves to be hated by David. So Hanun and the sons of Ammon sent silver weighing as much as 1,000 men, to get war-wagons and horsemen from Mesopotamia, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They paid for 32,000 war-wagons and for the king of Maacah and his army who came and set up their tents by Medeba. Then the sons of Ammon gathered together from their cities and came to battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of his strong men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ammon came out and were ready for battle at the city gate. The kings who had come were by themselves in the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab saw that the battle was set against him in front and behind. So he chose some of the best men of Israel and they made themselves ready to fight the Syrians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he had his brother Abishai lead the rest of the men. And they made themselves ready to fight the sons of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then help me. But if the sons of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be strong; let us show our strength of heart because of our people, and for the cities of our God. May the Lord do what is good in His eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joab and the men who were with him came near to fight against the Syrians. And the Syrians ran away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ammon saw that the Syrians ran away. So they ran away from Joab’s brother Abishai, and went into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Syrians saw that they had lost the war with Israel. So they sent men with news, and brought out the Syrians who were on the other side of the Euphrates River. Shophach the captain of Hadadezer’s army was leading them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was told about it, he gathered all Israel together and crossed the Jordan. He came to them, and made his army ready to fight against them. When David made his army ready for battle, the Syrians fought against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Syrians ran away from Israel. David killed 7,000 Syrians who drove war-wagons and 40,000 Syrian foot soldiers. And he killed Shophach the captain of the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadadezer’s servants saw that they had lost the war against Israel. So they made peace with David and worked for him. The Syrians were not willing to help the sons of Ammon any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the spring, at the time when kings go out to battle, Joab led out the army. He destroyed the land of the sons of Ammon. And he gathered his army around Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. Joab fought against Rabbah, and won.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David took the crown from their king’s head. He found that its gold weighed as much as an older child. And there were stones of much worth in it. It was placed on David’s head. He brought out the riches of the city, a very large amount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought out the people who were in it, and made them work with saws, iron picks, and axes. David did this to all the cities of the sons of Ammon. Then he and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this there was a war with the Philistines at Gezer. Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, who was one of the sons of those who were very tall and strong. And the Philistines were put under their power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was war with the Philistines again. Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite. Goliath’s spear was as big as the cross-piece of a cloth-maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was war at Gath. A very tall man was there who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in all. He was a son of those who were very tall and strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he spoke against Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were sons of the people of Gath who were very tall and strong. And they were killed by David and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David said to Joab and the leaders of the people, “Go and number Israel from Beersheba to Dan. Then let me know how many people there are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab said, “May the Lord add to His people a hundred times as many as they are! But, my lord the king, are they not all my lord’s servants? Why does my lord want this thing done? Why should he bring guilt upon Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the king’s word was stronger than Joab. So Joab left and went through all of Israel, and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave the number of all the people to David. There were 1,100,000 men in all Israel who used the sword. And there were 470,000 men in Judah who used the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joab did not number Levi and Benjamin among them because he did not like what the king had told him to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God was not pleased that Israel was numbered so He punished Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, “I have sinned very much by doing this thing. But now I beg You, take away the sin of Your servant for I have done a very foolish thing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Gad, David’s man of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and tell David, ‘This is what the Lord says. “I give you three things to choose from. Choose one of them, that I may do it to you.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said, “This is what the Lord says. ‘Choose one of these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three years of no food in the land; three months to be destroyed by the sword of those who hate you; or three days of the sword of the Lord. This would be a disease sent upon the land. The angel of the Lord would destroy with disease through all the land of Israel.’ Now decide what answer I should give Him Who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Gad, “I am in much trouble. Let me fall into the hand of the Lord. For His loving-kindness is very great. But do not let me fall into the hand of man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord sent a disease upon Israel. And 70,000 men of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem. But as he was about to destroy it, the Lord saw the trouble and was sorry. He said to the destroying angel, “It is enough. Now take your hand away.” The angel of the Lord was standing by the grain-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David looked up and saw the angel of the Lord standing between earth and heaven. The angel had his sword in his hand, held out over Jerusalem. Then David and the leaders fell on their faces. They were dressed in cloth made from hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, “Was it not I who said that the people must be numbered? I am the one who has sinned and done a very bad thing. But what have these sheep done? O Lord my God, I beg You, let Your hand be against me and my father’s house. But do not let the trouble be upon Your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord told Gad to say to David, “Go up and build an altar to the Lord on the grain-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up when he heard what Gad said in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ornan was beating the grain. He turned and saw the angel. And his four sons hid themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ornan looked and saw David coming. So he went out from the grain-floor and put his face to the ground showing respect to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to him, “Give me this part of the grain-floor, that I may build an altar on it to the Lord. Give it to me for the full price. Then the disease will be turned away from the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ornan said to David, “Take it. Let my lord the king do what is good in his eyes. See, I will give the bulls for burnt gifts. I will give the objects made of wood used for beating grain for the fire-wood. And I will give the grain for the grain gift. I will give it all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King David said to Ornan, “No, I will buy it for the full price. I will not take what is yours for the Lord. And I will not give a burnt gift for which I do not pay.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave Ornan 600 pieces of gold by weight for the place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David built an altar there to the Lord. He gave burnt gifts and peace gifts, and he called to the Lord. The Lord answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told the angel to return his sword to its holder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David saw that the Lord had answered him on the grain-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he gave his gifts there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The meeting tent which Moses had made in the desert was in the high place at Gibeon then. The altar of burnt gifts was there also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David could not go in front of it to pray to God. For he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “This is the house of the Lord God. And this is the altar of burnt gifts for Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David told his men to gather the strangers who were in the land of Israel. And he had servants cut stones to build the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave large amounts of iron to be used for making nails for the doors of the gates, and for making the parts that hold it all together. He gave more brass than could be weighed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave too many cedar trees to number. For the Sidonians and Tyrians brought many cut cedar trees to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “My son Solomon is young and does not yet have much learning. And the house that is to be built for the Lord must be very beautiful. It must be very great, and well-known in all lands. So I will get things ready for it to be built.” David made many things ready for it before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for his son Solomon, and gave him the work of building a house for the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Solomon, “My son, I had planned to build a house to the name of the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have taken much blood, and have fought many wars. You are not to build a house to My name, because you have poured so much blood upon the earth before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, a son will be born to you, who will be a man of peace. I will give him peace from all those who hate him on every side. His name will be Solomon. And I will give peace and quiet to Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will build a house for My name. He will be My son, and I will be his father. I will make his throne in Israel last forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, my son, may the Lord be with you and help you to do well. May you build the house of the Lord your God just as He has said you would.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only, may the Lord give you wisdom and understanding. When He has you rule over Israel, may you keep the Law of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will do well, if you are careful to obey the Laws which the Lord gave to Israel by Moses. Be strong and have strength of heart. Do not be afraid or troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With much trouble I have made things ready for the house of the Lord. There is gold weighing as much as 100,000 men. There is silver weighing as much as 1,000,000 men. And there is too much brass and iron to weigh. I have made wood and stone ready, and you may add to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have many servants and workmen who cut and build with stones and wood. There are men who are able to do every kind of work well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the gold and silver and brass and iron, there is more than enough. So get ready and work, and may the Lord be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David told all the leaders of Israel to help his son Solomon. He said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not the Lord your God with you? Has He not given you peace on every side? For He has given the people of the land into my hand. The land is put under my rule before the Lord and His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now set your heart and soul to look to the Lord your God. Get ready and build the holy place of the Lord God. Then you may bring the special box with the Law of the Lord. You may bring the holy objects of God. And put them into the house that is to be built for the name of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was an old man, he made his son Solomon king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered together all the leaders of Israel, the religious leaders, and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites were numbered from thirty years old and older. Their number was 38,000.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of these, 24,000 were to watch over the work of the Lord’s house. There were 6,000 who were leaders and men who were to judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 4,000 gate-keepers. And 4,000 were praising the Lord with the things for playing music that David had made.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David divided them into groups by the sons of Levi, Gershon and Kohath and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan were Jehiel the first, then Zetham and Joel, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three sons of Shimei were Shelemoth, Haziel and Haran. These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Ladan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jahath was the first, and Zizah the second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were numbered together as one father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The four sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart for holy work, he and his sons forever. They were to burn special perfume before the Lord, and do His work. And they were to pray for good to come to the people in the Lord’s name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the names of the sons of Moses the man of God were among the family of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Gershom was Shebuel the leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah the leader. Eliezer had no other sons. But Rehabiah had many sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Izhar was Shelomith the leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jehaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Uzziel were Micah the first, and Isshiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar died and had no sons, only daughters. Their brothers the sons of Kish married them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The three sons of Mushi were Mahli and Eder and Jeremoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi by their fathers’ houses. They were the heads of the fathers’ houses of those whose names were numbered from twenty years old and older. They were to do the work of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David said, “The Lord God of Israel has given peace to his people. And He lives in Jerusalem forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites do not need to carry the meeting tent and all the parts for its work any longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered, from twenty years old and older.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Their duties are to help Aaron’s sons with the work of the Lord’s house, in the open spaces and in the rooms. They are to make clean all the holy things, and do any work needed to be done in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to take care of the holy bread, the fine flour for a grain gift, and the bread without yeast. They are to take care of what is baked, and what is well mixed, of all the right amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are to stand every morning and evening to thank and praise the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they are to give all the burnt gifts to the Lord on the Days of Rest, the new moons, and the special days. They are to do this before the Lord all the time, by the number set by the Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way they are to take care of the meeting tent, the holy place, and help their brothers the sons of Aaron, for the work of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the family groups of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nadab and Abihu died before their father died. They had no sons, so Eleazar and Ithamar became the religious leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the help of Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, David divided them by their given duties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: More leaders were found from the sons of Eleazar than the sons of Ithamar. So they were divided in this way. There were sixteen heads of families of the sons of Eleazar. And there were eight heads of families of the sons of Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were divided by drawing names, all alike. For there were leaders of the holy place and leaders of God, from both the sons of Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The writer Shemaiah, the Levite son of Nethanel, wrote down their names. He wrote them in front of the king, the princes, Zadok the religious leader, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the families of the religious leaders and of the Levites. One family was taken for Eleazar, and one for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first name drawn was Jehoiarib, the second Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third Harim, the fourth Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth Malchijah, the sixth Mijamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh name was Hakkoz, the eighth Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ninth Jeshua, the tenth Shecaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the eleventh Eliashib, the twelfth Jakim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thirteenth name was Huppah, the fourteenth Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifteenth Bilgah, the sixteenth Immer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventeenth name was Hezir, the eighteenth Happizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the nineteenth Pethahiah, the twentieth Jehezkel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-first name was Jachin, the twenty-second Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the twenty-third Delaiah, and the twenty-fourth Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the way they were to come on duty to work in the Lord’s house. It was a rule given to them through their father Aaron, just as the Lord God of Israel had told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the sons of Levi were Shubael of the sons of Amram, Jehdeiah of the sons of Shubael,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Isshiah was the first of the sons of Rehabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Shelomoth of the Izharites, and Jahath of the sons of Shelomoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Hebron, there were Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was Micah of the sons of Uzziel, and Shamir of the sons of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The brother of Micah was Isshiah. There was Zechariah of the sons of Isshiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. Jaaziah’s son was Beno.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Merari by Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His son by Mahli was Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His son by Kish was Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The head of each family and his younger brother drew names just as their brothers the sons of Aaron did. They drew them in front of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the families of the religious leaders and of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David and the captains of the army set apart for the work some of the sons of Asaph, of Heman and of Jeduthun. They were to speak God’s Word while harps and timbrels were playing. These are the names of those who served in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asaph were: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asharelah. They were led by Asaph, who spoke for God under the leading of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The six sons of Jeduthun were: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah. They were led by their father Jeduthun, who spoke God’s Word using the harp, giving thanks and praising the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Heman were: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamtiezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir and Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman the king’s man of God, to honor him by the Words of God. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them were led by their father to sing in the Lord’s house. They sang and played timbrels and harps, serving in the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun and Heman were led by the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of those and their brothers who were taught to sing to the Lord, all who were very good singers, was 288.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drew names for their work, the young and old alike, also the teacher and the one who was taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are how the names were drawn. First was Joseph the son of Asaph. The second was Gedaliah. Together with his brothers and sons, there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third was Zaccur. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth was Izri. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth was Nethaniah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth was Bukkiah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh was Jesharelah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth was Jeshaiah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth was Mattaniah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth was Shimei. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh was Azarel. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth was Hashabiah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thirteenth was Shubael. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourteenth was Mattithiah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifteenth was Jeremoth. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixteenth was Hananiah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventeenth was Joshbekashah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighteenth was Hanani. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nineteenth was Mallothi. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twentieth was Eliathah. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-first was Hothir. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-second was Giddalti. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-third was Mahazioth. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the twenty-fourth was Romamti-ezer. With his sons and brothers there were twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gate-keepers were divided up. Of the Korahites there was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, a son of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah’s sons were Zechariah the first-born, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elam was his fifth son, Johanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obed-edom’s sons were Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ammiel was his sixth son, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth. God had brought good to the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To his son Shemaiah sons were born who ruled over their father’s house. They were strong, able men with strength of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed and Elzabad. Their brothers, Elihu and Semachiah, were strong and able men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were sons of Obed-edom. They and their sons and brothers were able men with strength for the work. There were sixty-two men from Obed-edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, eighteen strong and able men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Hosah, one of Merari’s sons: Shimri was the first. (He was not the first-born, but his father made him first.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah was his second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. Hosah had thirteen sons and brothers in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These leaders of the families who were set apart as gate-keepers were given duties like their brothers to work in the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families drew names by their fathers’ houses, the small and the large alike, for every gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelemiah’s name was drawn for the east gate. Then they drew the name of his son Zechariah for the north gate. Zechariah used much wisdom talking with people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obed-edom’s name was drawn for the south gate. And his sons were to watch the store-house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shuppim and Hosah’s names were drawn for the west gate beside the gate of Shallecheth, on the road that goes up a hill. Each one was given his duty to watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were six Levites on the east. There were four each day on the north. There were four each day on the south. There were two at one time at the store-house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were four at the road. And there were two at the place between the west wall of the Lord’s house and the wall of the open space.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the way the gate-keepers of the sons of Korah and Merari were divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers the Levites watched over the riches of the house of God and the riches of the holy gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan, who were Gershonites through the family group of Ladan were Jehielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel, watched over the riches of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites and the Uzzielites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebuel the son of Gershom, son of Moses, was the captain over the riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shelomoth and his brothers watched over all the riches of the holy gifts. These gifts had been set apart by King David and the heads of the fathers’ houses, the captains of thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set apart things taken in battles to do the work needed on the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Samuel the man of God had set apart gifts. So had Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, and everyone who had set apart anything. All these holy gifts were in the care of Shelomoth and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were given outside duties for Israel. They were leaders and men who decide who is guilty or not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers were leaders of Israel west of the Jordan. They were 1,700 able men who did all the work of the Lord and the work of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was the leader of the Hebronites by their families and fathers’ houses. Very able men were found among them at Jazer in Gilead in the fortieth year of David’s rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerijah and his brothers were 2,700 able men, heads of fathers’ houses. King David chose them to take care of all the duties of God and of the king, among the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-family group of the Manassites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Israel, the heads of fathers’ houses. They were the leaders of thousands and of hundreds. These were the captains who worked for the king in anything to do with the armies which came in and went out every month of the year. There were 24,000 men in each army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel was the leader of the first army for the first month. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a son of Perez, and head of all the captains of the army for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dodai the Ahohite was the leader of the army for the second month. Mikloth was the head captain. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third leader of the army for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the religious leader. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the Benaiah who was the strong man of the thirty, and leader of the thirty. Ammizabad his son was captain of his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth leader for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth leader for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite of the sons of Ephraim. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite of the Zerahites. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite of the Benjamites. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite of the Zerahites. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite of the sons of Ephraim. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite of Othniel. There were 24,000 in his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders of the family groups of Israel were: Eliezer the son of Zichri was the head captain of the Reubenites; Shephatiah the son of Maacah led the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hashabiah the son of Kemuel led the sons of Levi; Zadok led the sons of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elihu, one of David’s brothers, led the sons of Judah; Omri the son of Michael led the sons of Issachar;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah led the sons of Zebulun; Jeremoth the son of Azriel led the sons of Naphtali;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hoshea the son of Azaziah led the sons of Ephraim; Joel the son of Pedaiah led the half-family group of Manasseh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iddo the son of Zechariah led the half-family group of Manasseh in Gilead; Jaasiel the son of Abner led the sons of Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Azarel the son of Jeroham led the sons of Dan. These were the leaders of the families of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David did not number those younger than twenty years old because the Lord had promised to make Israel many, as the stars of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah had begun to number them, but did not finish. Anger came upon Israel because of this. So the number was not put into the book of the chronicles of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king’s store-houses. Jonathan the son of Uzziah was over the store-houses in the country, in the cities, in the towns, and in the towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who worked in the fields, plowing and planting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei the Ramathite was over the grape-fields. Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the fruit of the grape-fields for the wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baalhanan the Gederite was over the olive and sycamore trees in the plains. Joash was captain of the stores of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shitrai the Sharonite was over the cattle which were eating in the fields of Sharon. Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the cattle in the valleys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels. Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jaziz the Hagrite was over the flocks. All these were over all that belonged to King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jonathan, the brother of David’s father, used much wisdom talking with people. And he was a writer. Jehiel the son of Hachmoni taught the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahithophel talked about problems with the king. Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abaiathar, talked with the king after Ahithophel. And Joab was the captain of the king’s army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gathered together all the leaders of Israel. There were leaders of the family groups, and leaders of the armies that served the king. There were captains of thousands, and of hundreds. There were leaders who cared for all the things and animals belonging to the king and his sons. There were the leaders and all the powerful soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David stood up and said, “Listen to me, my brothers and my people. I had wanted to build a house of rest for the special box with the Law of the Lord, a place for God to rest His feet, so I had made plans to build it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to me, ‘You must not build a house for My name, because you are a man of war and blood.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from all the house of my father to be the king of Israel forever. For He has chosen Judah to be a leader. And in the house of Judah, my father’s house, and among my father’s sons, He was pleased to make me king of all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has given me many sons. And of all my sons, He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the nation of the Lord over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to me, ‘Your son Solomon is the one who will build My house and My open spaces. For I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make him king forever, if he is faithful to obey My Words and My Laws, as he is doing now.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now I say to you in front of all these people of Israel, and in the hearing of our God: Be careful to do all the Law of the Lord your God. If you obey you will receive the good land and also leave it to your children after you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father. Serve Him with a whole heart and a willing mind. For the Lord looks into all hearts, and understands every plan and thought. If you look to Him, He will let you find Him. But if you turn away from Him, He will turn away from you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Listen now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a place of worship. Be strong, and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave his son Solomon the plan of the porch of the Lord’s house, its buildings, and its store-houses. He gave him the plan of the rooms on its second floor, its inside rooms, and the room for the mercy-seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him the plan of all he had in mind. It showed the open spaces of the Lord’s house, and all the rooms around them. It showed the store-houses of the house of God, and the store-houses of the holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave him the plan for the way the religious leaders and the Levites were to be divided up for all the work of the Lord’s house. He told how all the objects were to be used in worship in the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David gave the weight of all the gold objects to be used in each part of worship. He gave the weight for all the silver objects to be used in each part of the worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The plan gave the weight of gold for the gold lamp-stands and gold lamps. It gave the weight of each lamp-stand and its lamps. It gave the weight of silver for the silver lamp-stands. It gave the weight of each lamp-stand and its lamps, by the use of each lamp-stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It gave the weight of gold for each table of holy bread, and of silver for the silver tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It gave the weight of the meat-hooks, the pots and the cups of pure gold. It gave the weight for each of the gold and silver pots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It gave the weight of the fine gold of the altar of special perfume, and of the gold wagon and of the cherubim that spread out their wings and covered the special box with the Law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said, “This is in writing because His hand was upon me. He helped me to know all the plan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong. Have strength of heart, and do it. Do not be afraid or troubled, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not stop helping you. He will not leave you until all the work of the house of the Lord is finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, the religious leaders and the Levites are divided up to do all the work of the house of God. Every willing man who is able to do a special work will help you in all that is to be done. The leaders and all the people will do what you say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David said to all the people, “My son Solomon is the one God has chosen. He is still young and has not had much time to know what to do. It is a very big work because this beautiful house is not for man, but for the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given all that I have been able to give for the house of my God. I have given the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, and the brass for the things of brass. I have given the iron for the things of iron, and the wood for the things of wood. I have given stones of much worth, stones for setting, silver-white stones, and stones of different colors. I have given all kinds of stones of much worth, and many smooth, special white stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The house of my God means much to me. I have much gold and silver and I give it to the house of my God, together with all I have already given for the holy house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave gold weighing as much as 3,000 men, of the gold of Ophir. I gave fine silver weighing as much as 7,000 men, to cover the walls of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave gold for the things of gold, and silver for the things of silver for all the work done by the able men. Now who is willing to give himself and be set apart today to the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the rulers of the families gave because they wanted to. The leaders of the family groups of Israel, the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and those who watched over the king’s work gave because they wanted to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the work of the house of God, they gave gold weighing as much as 5,000 men, and 10,000 gold pieces. They gave silver weighing as much as 10,000 men. They gave brass weighing as much as 18,000 men, and iron weighing as much as 100,000 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever had stones of much worth gave them to the store-house of the house of the Lord, in the care of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people were filled with joy because they had been so willing to give. They gave their gift to the Lord with a whole heart. And King David was filled with great joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David praised the Lord in front of all the people. He said, “Honor and thanks be to You, O Lord God of Israel our father, forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, You have great power, shining-greatness and strength. Yes, everything in heaven and on earth belongs to You. You are the King, O Lord. And You are honored as head over all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both riches and honor come from You. You rule over all. Power and strength are in Your hand. The power is in Your hand to make great and to give strength to all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now, our God, we thank You. We praise Your great and honored name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But who am I and who are my people, that we should be able to give so much? For all things come from You. We have given You only what already belongs to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are strangers before You. We are just staying here for a time, as all our fathers did. Our days on the earth are like a shadow, and without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord our God, from Your hand are all these many things that we have given to build You a house for Your holy name. It all belongs to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O my God, I know that You test the heart and are pleased with what is right. I have given these things because I have wanted to with a clean heart. And now I have seen with joy how Your people who are here give gifts to You because they want to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the thoughts of the hearts of Your people. Lead their hearts to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give my son Solomon a perfect heart to keep Your Words and Your Laws and to obey them all. And so let him build the beautiful house I have planned and given for.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to all the people, “Now praise the Lord your God.” And all the people gave praise to the Lord, the God of their fathers. They bowed low to the ground before the Lord and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the next day they killed animals and gave burnt gifts in worship to the Lord.
They gave 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams and 1,000 lambs, with their drink gifts. They gave many gifts in worship for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they ate and drank that day with great joy before the Lord.
They made David’s son Solomon king a second time. They poured oil on him to set him apart as ruler for the Lord. And they set Zadok apart as religious leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king instead of his father David. Everything went well for him, and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the leaders and the powerful men and all the sons of King David promised to be faithful to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord brought much honor to Solomon in the eyes of all Israel. He gave him greater power than any king before him in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David the son of Jesse ruled over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ruled over Israel for forty years. He ruled in Hebron seven years, and in Jerusalem thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he died as an old man. He had lived many years, had many riches and much honor. And his son Solomon ruled in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The acts of King David, from first to last, are written in the books of Samuel, Nathan, and Gad, the men of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tell of all his rule, his power, and of the things which happened to him, to Israel, and to all the nations of the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
